intro: Saccolabium glomeratum, commonly known as the clustered false peacock flower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences that resemble peacock feathers, with bright yellow to orange petals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in suitable climates.
